title: Installed New Client Beta and huzzah, now I can't get to the login screen
body:
So I just woke up this morning, wanted to play some League to start off my day. Saw the new client update thing in the first launch screen that showed up, and thought, "Oh cool, I'd like to have a new League client to use, it'll probably look really cool."

I've now regretted that decision, because I can no longer get a login screen at all to show up anymore.

I keep getting the initial screen that has the free champ rotation and a couple other featured stories in the corners that's got the launch button to show up.

But after I hit launch, nothing. Or at least nothing anymore, the very first time I got a dark blue box to show up in the left hand side of my screen with nothing on it and no audio. Since then, I've gotten nothing.

Even now, I have had the launcher try to run to see if giving it 10 minutes or longer will actually get anything to appear. The answer seems to be a resounding no.

I think part of the problem is that the client beta itself has not properly installed. When it was downloading, it skipped from 55% downloaded to complete, without even having an install phase during the process. So I'm not sure if I can try reinstalling that specifically or not, my original scan of the FAQ I didn't see if that was an option.

Hopefully I don't have to reinstall the whole client now because even with the P2P transfer, it took 5 hours for me to install the client just about 6 months ago, so I don't want to do that again.

If anyone knows anything that could be helpful, please let me know. I'm all ears.

> I keep getting the initial screen that has the free champ rotation and a couple other featured stories in the corners that's got the launch button to show up.

This part is really interesting to me, because technically you shouldn't see that anymore.  Are you clicking on the same icon through a desktop or taskbar pin?  What happens if you try to open the updated client directly via **C:\Riot Games\League of Legends** then **LeagueClient.exe**?  If going this route works, you can Send To or Create Shortcut that icon to your desktop 

Let me know, and we'll go from there.  There's been a few posts with the open beta this morning, so I'm learning along with everyone!  :D

Hey peeps :)

I was having the same issue and found that changing the DNS to a Google public DNS solved it.
Try it out: https://developers.google.com/speed/public-dns/docs/using

If you do not want to click the link for any reason (it's a safe Google link) then just change your DNS on your network connection to the following:

Go to the Control Panel.
Click Network and Internet > Network and Sharing Center > Change adapter settings.
Select the connection for which you want to configure Google Public DNS. For example:

To change the settings for an Ethernet connection, right-click Local Area Connection > Properties.
To change the settings for a wireless connection, right-click Wireless Network Connection > Properties.
If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation.
Select the Networking tab. Under This connection uses the following items, select Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4) or Internet Protocol Version 6 (TCP/IPv6) and then click Properties.
Click Advanced and select the DNS tab. If there are any DNS server IP addresses listed there, write them down for future reference, and remove them from this window.
Click OK.
Select Use the following DNS server addresses. If there are any IP addresses listed in the Preferred DNS server or Alternate DNS server, write them down for future reference.
Replace those addresses with the IP addresses of the Google DNS servers:

Preferred DNS server
8.8.8.8 
Alternate DNS server
8.8.4.4.

Note: If there are any IP addresses listed in the Preferred DNS server or Alternate DNS server, write them down for future reference. 

I hope this helps other's as well <3

Much Love

You are not being forced to participate in the open beta test.  You can return to the legacy client at any time by selecting not to update it, or selecting Launch Legacy Client underneath the Sign In Button, or manually through the League of Legends folder via the lol.launcher.  If you want to updated client gone completely, you can also perform a [reinstall](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends).  Hope that helps!
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/215576628/Launch-Legacy-Client.jpg

Is there a way to launch the legacy client without being able to reach the login screen? I'm having the same problem as OP, the login screen won't pop up. It has only popped up as a black screen when I tried to open a second instance of league, and I couldn't close the black screen until I went through task manager.

The black screen may be due to a connection problem and failng to download assets.  You can give our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide a go to try and fix that.

Otherwise, I mentioned that you can manually open the legacy client manually through your PC:

Navigate to the location you installed League, likely **C:\Riot Games\League of Legends**

In this directory, you should be able to find a client called **lol.launcher**, you can right click it and **Create Shortcut**, or **Send to** > **Desktop**, which will send a Shortcut back to your desktop.

Aha, thanks for this info!  Black screen issues like this are usually caused by a change in your network that's failing to keep a strong connection and download assets.  Go over the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure your connection is configured properly with the new client, which is something that's worked so far for some players.  

You can also download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to help automatically configure your firewall settings as well.

Let me know the outcome!

Used the Hextech Repair Tool (cute), still will not launch.   Running the LeagueClient.exe as admin does nothing other than start a task in task manager, and running it a 2nd time (assuming I don't end that process) gives a blank black window.

I ran the old .exe, which at least got me to the main screen to "Launch" (though launching no longer works), and did a repair which checked out over 10k files...still won't run.

Thanks for trying all that.  Unfortunately, I'm at a loss so hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team can look into this with you and help find out what's going on.  We'll reply back as soon as we can.
Thanks Porocles, I submitted a ticket, added the logs from the Hextech Repair tool.   Hopefully Riot figures this out soon, clearly it's effecting quite a few customers!
